abstract.p: Letter from Daniel S Mariaschin (B'nai B'rith International) calls on Vatican to open Holocaust-era archives (Oct 29 news article)

block.p: ''Jewish and Catholic Scholars Seek Pius XII's Files'' (news article, Oct. 27) highlights the widening chasm over transparency that separates the Vatican from others on the issue of opening Holocaust-era archives.

''Jewish and Catholic Scholars Seek Pius XII's Files'' (news article, Oct. 27) highlights the widening chasm over transparency that separates the Vatican from others on the issue of opening Holocaust-era archives.

More than 20 countries have now established commissions to investigate their actions in the Holocaust years, resulting in tens of thousands of documents' being made available to historians, government officials, the news media and the public.

It is time for the Vatican to follow the lead of many other European and Latin American governments and fully open its archives, which internationally recognized scholars believe contain vital information on the Holocaust era.

In that context, further action on the beatification of Pope Pius XII should await public availability of these archival documents, which surely can shed light on his role and that of the Vatican during World War II.
DANIEL S. MARIASCHIN Executive Vice President B'nai B'rith International Washington, Oct. 30, 2000
